**Balancing Exploration and Exploitation in Algorithm Selection**

In this work, we have developed a framework that effectively balances exploration and exploitation in algorithm selection for solving complex multi-modal problems. Our framework has demonstrated superior performance compared to other existing frameworks.

Although our research primarily focused on individual-based Successive Approximation Evolutionary Algorithms (SAEAs) for solving Combinatorial Optimization Problems (CEPs), future improvements will enable the portfolio framework to accommodate a broader range of optimization algorithms. Furthermore, selecting appropriate algorithm candidates for the portfolio is crucial as it directly impacts the framework's performance.

**Future Research Directions**

Investigating effective methods for choosing constituent algorithms in SAEAs is essential for enhancing the performance of the algorithm portfolio framework.
